books.author: by Laura Hillenbrand
books.description: An Olympic runner’s story of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II.
books.name: UNBROKEN

books.author: by Chris Kyle with Scott McEwen and Jim DeFelice
books.description: A former member of the Navy SEALs discusses his battlefield experiences during the Iraq war. Kyle was shot to death in Texas in 2013.
books.name: AMERICAN SNIPER

books.author: by Cheryl Strayed
books.description: A woman’s account of a life-changing 1,100-mile hike along the Pacific Crest Trail during the summer of 1995.
books.name: WILD

books.author: by Daniel James Brown
books.description: The University of Washington’s eight-oar crew and their quest for gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.
books.name: THE BOYS IN THE BOAT

books.author: by Rebecca Skloot
books.description: The story of a woman whose cancer cells were cultured without her permission in 1951.
books.name: THE IMMORTAL LIFE OF HENRIETTA LACKS

books.author: by Amy Poehler
books.description: A humorous miscellany from the comedian and actress, the “Saturday Night Live” alumna and star of “Parks and Recreation.”
books.name: YES PLEASE

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The host of “The O’Reilly Factor” recounts the strange death of Gen. George S. Patton in December 1945.
books.name: KILLING PATTON

books.author: by Atul Gawande
books.description: The surgeon and New Yorker writer considers how doctors fail patients at the end of life, and how they can do better.
books.name: BEING MORTAL

books.author: by Andie Mitchell
books.description: A memoir about the author’s long struggle with, and eventual victory over, obesity.
books.name: IT WAS ME ALL ALONG

books.author: by Steven Brill
books.description: The issues in American health care and health care reform and recent developments including the drafting and implementation of the Affordable Care Act, by the journalist, editor and lawyer.
books.name: AMERICA'S BITTER PILL

books.author: by Dan Harris
books.description: A co-anchor of "Nightline" reports on the science and spiritual dimensions of meditation and how it has improved his life.
books.name: 10% HAPPIER

books.author: by John Bailey
books.description: The story of an enigmatic woman’s fight for freedom in 19th-century New Orleans; first published in 2003.
books.name: THE LOST GERMAN SLAVE GIRL

books.author: by Lena Dunham
books.description: A collection of revealing and often humorous personal essays from the creator and star of “Girls.”
books.name: NOT THAT KIND OF GIRL

books.author: by Moises Naim
books.description: From board rooms to battlefields, why being in charge isn’t what it used to be.
books.name: THE END OF POWER

books.author: by Randall Munroe
books.description: Scientific (but often funny) answers to hypothetical questions, based in part on the author’s website, xkcd.com.
books.name: WHAT IF?
